intro: Gethyllis verrucosa, commonly known as the African snowflake, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. The plant produces clusters of small, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often appearing after the flowers have faded. Gethyllis verrucosa is adapted to arid conditions and thrives in well-drained soils.
